## 1. Father and Son Released from Immigration Detention
![Article 1](/images/news/2026-02-01-1.png)

A father and his **5-year-old** son, Liam Conejo Ramos, are finally free after being held in an immigration **detention center**. They were released following a court order. The family had been separated for a while, causing many people to worry about the **impact** on the boy. Immigration detention can be very hard for families, especially young children. This story is important because it shows the challenges immigrant families face in the United States. People are now discussing how to improve the system and prevent such separations in the future.

> ### 영어 표현 학습
> - **5-year-old** — 5세의  
>   _My **5-year-old** niece loves to draw._
> - **detention center** — 구금 센터  
>   _The students visited a **detention center** to learn about the justice system._
> - **impact** — 영향  
>   _The new law will have a big **impact** on small businesses._

Source: [ABC News](https://news.google.?oc=5)

## 2. Insights from the Newly Released Epstein Files
![Article 2](/images/news/2026-02-01-2.png)

New files about Jeffrey Epstein have been **released**, providing more insight into his illegal activities. Epstein was a wealthy financier accused of serious crimes before his death in 2019. The files reveal details about his connections with powerful people. This information is important because it helps us understand how he was able to avoid justice for so long. People are now asking for more investigations to ensure everyone involved is held accountable.

> ### 영어 표현 학습
> - **released** — 공개된  
>   _The movie was **released** worldwide last Friday._
> - **financier** — 금융업자  
>   _The **financier** invested in many tech startups._
> - **avoid justice** — 법망을 피하다  
>   _He tried to **avoid justice** by leaving the country._

Source: [The Guardian](https://news.google.?oc=5)

---

## 3. Tariffs Cause Job Losses in the U.S.
![Article 3](/images/news/2026-02-01-3.png)

Recent reports show that tariffs may have caused the U.S. economy to **lose thousands** of jobs each month. Tariffs are taxes on imported goods, and they can make products more expensive. When costs go up, businesses may cut jobs to save money. This is a problem because it affects many people's **livelihoods**. Experts are suggesting that changing these policies could help the job market recover.

> ### 영어 표현 학습
> - **lose thousands** — 수천 개를 잃다  
>   _The company had to **lose thousands** of dollars due to the accident._
> - **tariffs** — 관세  
>   _The government imposed **tariffs** on imported steel._
> - **livelihoods** — 생계  
>   _Fishing is the main **livelihood** for many coastal communities._

Source: [Fox Business](https://news.google.?oc=5)
